Sentencas: To investigate the coupled mass transport and electrochemical reactions in porous anode of solid oxide fuel cell (SOFC), a pore scale model employing the multi-component Lattice Boltzmann (LB) model for mass transport in the pore phase and a six-step reaction for electrochemical reactions at three phase boundaries is established.
Titulo: Numerical investigation of coupled mass transport and electrochemical reactions in porous SOFC anode microstructure

Sentencas: This model is superior in including the effects of heterogeneity of anode microstructure, making it qualified to quantitatively simulate local distributions of various physical fields without dependence on any statistical parameters.
Titulo: Numerical investigation of coupled mass transport and electrochemical reactions in porous SOFC anode microstructure

Sentencas: The characteristics of coupled interactions of mass transport and electrochemical reaction are analyzed visually by comparing H-2 molar fraction distributions within the pore phase of the anode.
Titulo: Numerical investigation of coupled mass transport and electrochemical reactions in porous SOFC anode microstructure

Sentencas: It is demonstrated that, for anodes with different heterogeneous microstructures but with same porosity and tortuosity factor, the mass transport and electrochemical reaction process can be quite different, even under the same boundary conditions.
Titulo: Numerical investigation of coupled mass transport and electrochemical reactions in porous SOFC anode microstructure

Sentencas: Meanwhile, based on the same anode microstructure, species molar fraction varies similarly along the primary transport direction, even though the operating conditions are quite different.
Titulo: Numerical investigation of coupled mass transport and electrochemical reactions in porous SOFC anode microstructure

Sentencas: Besides, the influences of fuel composition, activation overpotential and operating temperature are also discussed at pore scale by the present model.
Titulo: Numerical investigation of coupled mass transport and electrochemical reactions in porous SOFC anode microstructure
